intro: Diandrostachya, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or brownish in color. Diandrostachya thrives in wet or moist environments, such as marshes and wetlands. It plays an important role in stabilizing soil and supporting aquatic ecosystems.
